meanings.definition: Thorn: a sharp-pointed spine on a plant.
meanings.sent1: The rose bush had a thorning that pricked my finger.
meanings.sent2: Be careful of the thorning on the cactus.
meanings.sent3: The thorning on the blackberry bush made picking berries a bit tricky.
meanings.sent4: The thorning of the holly bush acted as a natural defense against animals.
meanings.sent5: The thorning of the hawthorn tree was a reminder of nature's protection mechanisms.

meanings.definition: Thorny: full of or covered with thorns.
meanings.sent1: The thorny bush scratched my arm as I passed by.
meanings.sent2: The path was blocked by a thorny shrub.
meanings.sent3: The thorny situation required careful navigation to avoid getting hurt.
meanings.sent4: Her thorny personality made it challenging to have a conversation with her.
meanings.sent5: The thorny exterior of the plant served as a warning to stay away.

meanings.sent1: The thorned stem of the rose bush was beautiful yet dangerous.
meanings.sent2: The thorned branches of the tree made it difficult to climb.
meanings.sent3: The thorned gloves protected his hands while gardening.
meanings.sent4: The thorned vines intertwined to create a natural barrier.
meanings.sent5: The thorned edges of the leaves acted as a defense mechanism against herbivores.
